name: Seafood Patties
ingredients: 6 ounce can tuna or crab meat, drained
6 ounce frozen salad shrimp, thawed and drained
1/8 teaspoon Old Bay seasoning or paprika

instructions.en: Finely mince about 3/4 of the shrimp almost to a paste. Keep the rest whole for texture.
Optional: Saut√© the celery, green pepper, green onion and garlic in a little butter until tender-crisp.
In a medium bowl, combine the seafood and vegetable mixture. Using a fork, stir in the egg until very well incorporated.
Stir in all the seasonings, cheese and pork rinds. Mix well until it becomes a thick sort of paste.
Chill the mixture for at least 30 minutes.
Heat enough oil to at least cover the bottom of a very large nonstick skillet.
When the oil is hot, spoon in the seafood mixture, dividing into about 6-8 mounds. Using two spoons, gently shape and flatten into patties.
Fry on medium heat until very nicely browned on bottom. Don't flip until well-browned. Flip and brown well on the other side.

notes: You can divide the 'batter' differently depending on desired servings: for 2-3 servings, make 6 patties; for 4 servings, make 8 small patties. The patties are tender and quite fragile. This recipe can be frozen.
